member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.HierarchicalInterview
member.summary: Object represents a hierarchical interview with a main parent interview

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.HierarchicalInterview.Level
member.summary: Indicates which level of the hierarchy an interview is associated with

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.Interview
member.summary: Object representing a completed interview in a survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.Interview.InterviewId
member.summary: Unique identifier of an interview

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.Interview.Date
member.summary: Date interview was last changed

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.Interview.Complete
member.summary: Indicates whether the interview is considered a Complete interview or not

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.Interview.Responses
member.summary: List of responses given within the interview

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.VariableData
member.summary: Represents the response(s) given to a variable in the survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.VariableData.VariableId
member.summary: The Id of the variable to which a set of variable data relates to

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.VariableData.Data
member.summary: List of responses given for this variable

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.VariableDataItem
member.summary: Object representing a data value or response for a variable in an interview

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.VariableDataItem.Value
member.summary: A specified variable response

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.VariableDataItem.State
member.summary: (Optional) state of a response. Permitted values are "selected", "notSelected", "notShown" Used to provide information about exactly which closed end responses were shown/selected/unselected in a given iterview

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Interviews.VariableDataItem.LoopedVariableData
member.summary: (Optional) Data for looped variables which are child responses connected to a VariableDataItem

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Hierarchy
member.summary: Represents a hierarchical sub-questionnaire within a main survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Hierarchy.HierarchyId
member.summary: Unique identifier of a hierarchy item

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Hierarchy.Parent
member.summary: One or more parent elements may be defined for each level element.

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Hierarchy.Metadata
member.summary: The metadata (list of questions and variables) for a hierarchy item

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.ParentDetails.Level
member.summary: The level_ident of the associated parent level. For example, in a household-person hierarchy, the parent_level_ident of the person level would be the level_ident of the household level.

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.ParentDetails.LinkVar
member.summary: The LinkVar is the name of the linking variable that appears in both child and parent data sets.It must be a quantity or character type variable. This variable must have the same name in the different (parent and child) data sets.The variable used as the linking variable must, at the “parent” level, have unique and unduplicated data values in each record (that is, no two records can have the same value).

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.ParentDetails.Ordered
member.summary: The Ordered is optional and identifies whether the data in the corresponding level is ordered or not. It must be one of: - yes data in the parent level is ordered - no data in the parent level should be treated as unordered If Ordered is not explicitly specified the value "no" is assumed.

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Label
member.summary: Object representing a text label within a survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Label.Text
member.summary: The main/default text used as a label

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Label.AltLabels
member.summary: List of alternative labels use that can be used instead of Text value in certain circumstances

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.AltLabel
member.summary: Object representing an alternative text label

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.AltLabel.Mode
member.summary: Signals whether a text should be used during interviewing and/or analysis. Two explicit modes are available: “interview” and “analysis”. In the absence of a mode specification, the appropriate text is assumed to be used in both modes. Allowable values are "interview" and "analysis"

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.AltLabel.Text
member.summary: Text value to use as an alternative label

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.AltLabel.LanguageId
member.summary: Indicates that an alt label should be used when interviewing in a given language

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Language
member.summary: Object representing a language in use within a survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Language.LanguageId
member.summary: The unique Id that is used to refer to a language within the survey metadata and interview data. Although there is no restriction on language id, the intended values of this attribute are described in the official W3C XML version 1.0 specification as:- "The values of the attribute are language identifiers as defined by IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force) RFC 3066, "Tags for the Identification of Languages"(http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt) or its successor on the Standards Track."

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Language.Name
member.summary: The human readable name used to refer to a language

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Language.SubLanguages
member.summary: List of sub-languages (if any) that are grouped within the parent language (e.g. English => en-GB, en-US)

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.OtherSpecifyVariable
member.summary: Object representing an “other specify” variable within a closed-end variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.OtherSpecifyVariable.ParentValueId
member.summary: Defines the id of the closed end response that an other-specify is attached to

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Section
member.summary: Object representing a section within a survey. Sections are used to partition variables together into logical groups (e.g. Screener, System, Demographics, Main Survey etc…)

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Section.Label
member.summary: Human readable label used to name to a section

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Section.Variables
member.summary: List of variables

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Section.Sections
member.summary: List of sub-sections (if any) within this section

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyDetail
member.summary: Object representing an available survey within the API system

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyDetail.Id
member.summary: The unique Id that the API system uses internally to identify a given survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyDetail.Name
member.summary: The human readable identifer assigned to the survey within the API system. For example, this may contain an internal job number such as "TS-002"

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyDetail.Title
member.summary: The human-readable name assigned to the survey within the API system. For example, "Restaurant Satisfaction Survey"

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadata
member.summary: Object representing a survey and all of its metadata (information about questionnaire variables)

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadata.Hierarchies
member.summary: List of hierarchical questionnaires (if any) within a survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadataBase.Name
member.summary: The human readable identifer assigned to the survey within the API system. For example, this may contain an internal job number such as "TS-002"

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadataBase.Title
member.summary: The human-readable name assigned to the survey within the API system. For example, "Restaurant Satisfaction Survey"

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadataBase.InterviewCount
member.summary: The total number of interviews within the survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadataBase.Languages
member.summary: List of language objects defining the languages used within the survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadataBase.Variables
member.summary: List of variables (if any) defined at the root level of the survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.SurveyMetadataBase.Sections
member.summary: List of sub-sections (if any) defined at the root level of the survey

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable
member.summary: Object representing a variable or question within a survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.VariableId
member.summary: Unique identifier for this variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.Ordinal
member.summary: The order of this variable within the overall survey

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.Type
member.summary: The type of variable. Value values are: "single", "multiple", "quantity", "character", "logical", "date", "time"

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.Name
member.summary: Human-readable name for a variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.Label
member.summary: Label or question text for a variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.Use
member.summary: Special use type for this variable. Valid values are: "serial", "weight", "language", "wave", "translation"

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.Values
member.summary: List of closed-end responses for this variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.MaxResponses
member.summary: Maximum number of responses that can be given for this variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.LoopedVariables
member.summary: Looped child variables for this variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Variable.OtherSpecifyVariables
member.summary: List of other specify child variables for this variable (when type = Single or Multiple)

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.VariableValues
member.summary: Object representing an allowable set of values for a variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.VariableValues.ValueListId
member.summary: Identifier for this list of variable values. Can be used to identify value lists that are shared between variables

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.VariableValues.Range
member.summary: Defines an overall range of legal values for a variable

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.VariableValues.Values
member.summary: Defines a set of response values for closed-end variables

member.name: T:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Value
member.summary: Object representing a closed-end question response

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Value.ValueId
member.summary: Unique identifier for a response value

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Value.Code
member.summary: Entry code (if-any) for a response value

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Value.Label
member.summary: The human readable label for a response value

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.Value.Score
member.summary: The optional score attribute can only be used when the variable is of type single. It allows score values to be assigned to the individual code values to be used for computing statistics such as Mean, Standard Deviation etc. The score_value must be a number, and may be positive, negative or zero, with or without a decimal point and decimal places.The omission of a score implies that records having that value code should be omitted from the base for any statistical computation for that variable.

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.ValueRange.From
member.summary: Defines the lower band of a range value. Must be lower than or equal to the "To" value

member.name: P:TSAPI.Public.Domain.Metadata.ValueRange.To
member.summary: Defines the upper band of range value. Must be greater than or equal to the "From" value
